descriptionarticle.text: Decompressor's limit on blocks per MCU.

p.text: This value is specified by the JPEG standard, so don't change it if you want to be compatible.

Unfortunately, Adobe saw no reason to be bound by the standard; the PostScript DCT filter can emit files with many more than 10 blocks per MCU. If you happen to run across such a file, you can up D_MAX_BLOCKS_IN_MCU to handle it. However, we strongly discourage changing C_MAX_BLOCKS_IN_MCU; just because Adobe sometimes emits noncompliant files doesn't mean you should too.
